director.name: 盖佐·贝瑟尔梅尼 Géza Böszörményi

trans_title: 赖奇克1950-1953年：匈牙利人民共和国秘密劳动营纪事
introduction: This European Film Award winner documentary tells the story of Recsk, Hungary's mos t notorious political prison camp, which operated between 1950 and 1953. During the early 1950's the very existence of this camp for political prisoners at Recsk was one of the Hungarian communist regime's deepest secrets. Hundreds of people were taken there without ever actually being sentenced by any court, and had to suffer through the brutal treatment handed down by their sadistic captors. This documentary tells the story of Recsk from both the captors' and the prisoners' point of view, capturing the atmosphere of paranoia, humiliation and degradation that prevailed throughout the Stalinist gulag system.
